plant.description:
Brief Description
• Appearance: This plant is a perennial herb that contains a milky sap1. It features erect stems with glossy green, opposite leaves and produces solitary flowers that are typically rose-pink to white in color1.
• Habitat and Common Locations: Because of its attractive flowers and foliage, it is widely cultivated and most commonly found as an ornamental plant

toxins.name: Vinca alkaloids (which include vincristine and vinblastine)
toxins.description:
in cats: When ingested, these toxins cause severe systemic and localized damage. They lead to peripheral nerve damage, bone marrow suppression (depression), and cardiovascular damage1. Additionally, they act as severe irritants to the digestive tract, causing pharyngeal (throat) pain, significant abdominal pain, severe diarrhea, and subsequent dehydration1.

toxins.concentration_notes: These highly dangerous alkaloids are distributed throughout the entire plant1. Due to the severity of the effects on the nerves, bone marrow, and cardiovascular system, aggressive supportive and symptomatic veterinary treatment, along with extended monitoring, is essential

treatments.name: Aggressive Supportive and Symptomatic Care
treatments.description: The veterinarian will provide intensive, targeted therapies to manage the cat's specific clinical signs as they develop. Based on the symptoms caused by the plant, this involves treating severe dehydration (likely via fluid therapy) and managing significant pharyngeal (throat) and abdominal pain
treatments.notes:
This aggressive intervention is considered absolutely essential because the toxins act as severe gastrointestinal irritants and cause life-threatening systemic damage1.
2. Extended Medical Monitoring

treatments.name: Extended Monitoring
treatments.description: The cat will require prolonged veterinary observation and testing to continuously evaluate its vitals and internal systems over time
treatments.notes: This extended monitoring is critical because the toxins in Madagascar Periwinkle cause complex, deep-tissue complications, including cardiovascular damage, peripheral nerve damage, and bone marrow suppression (depression)
